definition: roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: In the legislation, the organized robbery crime should be further improved.
sentences.chinese: 在立法上，對聚衆哄搶罪還應作進一步完善。

sentences.english: One looter was killed when the 2 sides exchanged fire.
sentences.chinese: 雙方發生交火，一名哄搶者被擊斃。

sentences.english: Police arrived and shot one of the looters, eyewitnesses said.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者說，警方到達現場，打死了一名哄搶者。

sentences.english: He has starred in Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet and Joe Orton's Loot.
sentences.chinese: 他主演的哈姆雷特，羅密歐與茱麗葉和喬奧頓的哄搶。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
